results.title: The Joker to the thief
results.brief_description: A surreal hand-drawn computer animation of a thief who steals his way into a mediaeval castle. Filled with hallucenogenic imagery the thief is surrounded by magic, scenes of madness and other horrors. He attempts to flee but is followed by the joker equipped with his tricks.

results.title: The Pyre of Triune
results.brief_description:
A paint-on-glass animation exploring personal themes of spirituality - representing a journey into the soul and the discovery of the spirit of god, a struggle for meaning and the light within.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 1997.

results.title: Man in the white suit
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A scientist, played by Alec Guinnes, invents a fabric that never gets dirty and never wears out. Unions and management are equally perturbed by this and endeavour to prevent its manufacture. Academy Award nomination for scripting.

results.title: Saraband for dead lovers
results.creator_credit: Basil Dearden, Sir Michael Balcon, Rank Film Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
George the Ist of England came from the small independent German state of Hanover and when he succeeded to the throne of England, he left behind a prisoner in the Castle of Ahlden, Princess Sophia Dorothea, his wife. She married George Louis against her will and this is a tragic tale full of melodrama, intrigue and spectacle. The costumes and settings alike will delight. Stewart Granger, Joan Greenwood, Francoise Rosay, Flora Robson, Anthony Quayle and Michael Gough star in this period drama based on a novel by Helen Simpson.

results.title: A Secret war room
results.creator_credit: Joan Peck, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Joan Peck served in the WAAAF as a radio telephone operator at Number one fighter sector in Preston. Their main role was to connect the army, navy and airforce in one central control to help protect and defend the Victorian coastline. Peck used state of the art technology at work, yet didn’t even have a telephone at home. Her highly secretive and crucial work at the centre was often interspersed with a spot of knitting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Peck, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Look up and laugh
results.creator_credit: Basil Dean, Ealing Studios and ATP
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
Great English songbird Gracie Fields stars as touring variety artist Grace Pearson. Grace expects a happy time at home after a long tour. When she returns, all she meets is doom and gloom. Belfer, the owner of a big store is at war with the local market stallholders, one of whom is Grace’s father. Belfer wants to close the market and extend his shop. Matters become complicated as Belfer’s daughter and Grace’s brother fall in love. At Grace’s suggestion, the market stallholders organise a barricade in order to win the day. Starring Douglas Wakefield, Harry Tate and Vivien Leigh in this classic Ealing production. J.B. Priestly wrote the screenplay.

results.title: [Washing machine: Santa]
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. When people co-habit there are usually differences in how we choose to live. Santa and his live-in unicorn ‘creature’ have theirs because what is one person’s washing machine is another’s Jacuzzi.

results.title: Hue and cry
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Henry Cornelius, Sir Michael Balcon, Rank Film Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
While reading a hair-rasing serial in the magazine “The Trump”, 15 year-old Joe Kirby finds that his over-active imagination has exceeded itself and he lands right in the middle of the story. Joe convinces himself and friends that the magazine installments are being used as a means of secret communication by a masterly gang of criminals. Starring Alastair Sim, Jack Warner, Valerie White and Jack Lambert.
